column4: apoulos: OK.  this is what i do. i have circle screenlets setup to display ram usage, cpu usage, fan speed, hdd and cpu temps.  i close any unnecessary applications on my host.  then i start the guest.  i keep an eye on the sensors at all times, and if i feel any of them are venturing towards a critical range, i stop or slow down the process that is causing it.  with these best practices, i find it mitigates the risk of "frying" my sys
don't u think screenlet itself is too heavy? why not use something like a conky? :P
it takes less than 20mb.  my system has sufficient ram to manage that weight.
